alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 12:44PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF US-89 IN COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 115 PM MST... At 1243 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nalahiku Pueblo in Wupatki N.M., or 25 miles north of Flagstaff, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nalahiku Pueblo in Wupatki N.M. and Wupatki National Monument. This includes U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 437 and 450. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Western Mogollon Rim
